intro: Silene otites subsp. otites, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The plant is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its distinctive floral structures and ecological adaptations.
